      • includeResource

        private void includeResource(ServletRequest request,
                   Response response,
                   RequestDispatcher dispatch)
                      throws ServletException,
                             java.io.IOException

        Before forwarding we need to know the content length of the target resource in order to configure the response properly. This is necessary because the valve already have written to the response, and we want to override with the target resource data.

        Parameters:
        request -
        response -
        dispatch -
        Throws:
        ServletException
        java.io.IOException

      • populateSessionWithSAMLParameters

        private void populateSessionWithSAMLParameters(Request request)
                                        throws java.io.IOException

        SAML parameters are also populated into session if they are present in the request. This allows the IDP to retrieve them later when handling a specific SAML request or response.

        Parameters:
        request -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                                         java.lang.String issuer)
                                            throws ConfigurationException,
                                                   ProcessingException
        Returns the PublicKey to be used for the token's signature verification. This key is related with the issuer of the SAML message received by the IDP.

      • willIgnoreSignatureOfCurrentRequest

        private java.lang.Boolean willIgnoreSignatureOfCurrentRequest(java.lang.String spIssuer)
        We will ignore signatures of current SAMLRequest if SP Metadata are provided for current SP and if metadata specifies that SAMLRequest is not signed for this SP.
        Parameters:
        spIssuer -
        Returns:
        true if signature is not expected in SAMLRequest and so signature validation should be ignored
